alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Kiowa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 19 at 7:11PM CDT until September 19 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN COMANCHE AND EASTERN KIOWA COUNTIES... At 711 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cooperton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Mountain View, Mountain Park, Roosevelt, Gotebo, Cooperton, Tom Steed Reservoir, and Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
